title: 8 HC judges get permanent seats

organizations.name: high court division additional registrar (administration and justice

text:
8 HC judges get permanent seats Senior Correspondent, bdnews24.com   13:30:20.0   13:30:20.0 BdST Eight judges who were serving as Additional Justices to the High Court have been made permanent . 
They are Justice SM Mozibur Rahman, Justice Amir Hossain, Justice Khizir Ahmed Choudhury, Justice Razik-Al-Jalil, Justice Bhishmadev Chakrabortty, Justice Md Iqbal Kabir, Justice Md Salim, and Justice Md Shohrowardi. 
The Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs issued a decree appointing the eight judges to permanent positions on Tuesday, High Court Division Additional Registrar (Administration and Justice) Sabbir Fayez told bdnews24.com. 
A total of ten justices, including these eight, were appointed as Additional Justices to the High Court on Feb 9, 2015. 
Among them Jyotirmoy Narayan Deb Choudhury passed away last December. 
Supreme Court Registrar Md Farid Ahmed Shibli was also appointed as justice, but his name was not on the list of permanent justices. 
Before coming to the High Court, Justices SM Mozibur Rahman and Amir Hossain served as district judges. Mojibur Rahman was the acting justice who handled the trial of the 2004 10-truck arms haul casein Chittagong. 
Justices Razik-Al-Jalil, Bhishmadev Chakrabortty, Md Selim and Md Shohrowardi served as deputy attorney generals before their appointment. 
Justices Khizir Ahmed and Md Iqbal Kabir were Supreme Court lawyers.
